nl: If $p$ is a prime, show that $q(x) = 1 + x + x^2 + \cdots x^{p - 1}$ is irreducible in $Q[x]$.
lean:
∀ {p : ℕ} (hp : Nat.Prime p) :
  Irreducible (∑ i in Finset.range p, X ^ i, Polynomial ℚ)
candidate: ∀ {p : ℕ} (hp : p.Prime) : Irreducible (X ^ p - 1, Polynomial (ZMod p))
imports:
import Mathlib

open Fintype Set Real Ideal Polynomial
open scoped BigOperators
